result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontrell D Gibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA surcharge imposed and due in 1 year. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment.
Court waives all other non-mandatory and mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges due to the inability to pay.
Defendant to provide DNA by specimen by 7-14-2022 or face additional penalties.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrell D Gibbs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds Remotely. 


AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. 
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by State, Defense counsel and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: -   COURT ORDERED: 
Defendant to serve1 DAY  in the House of Correction, with  1 DAY of pretrial incarceration Credit.  
Court ordered a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

DNA surcharge Imposed and due in 1 year.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment.
Court waives all other non mandatory and mandatory costs, fees and surcharges  due to the inability to pay.
Defendant to provide DNA   by specimen by 7-14-202 or face additional penalties.  
Appellate rights given.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  OFF THE RECORD.  Scheduling conference held.  Atty. Romenesko requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 

This hearing will be be held, streamed Live, through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs not in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/7/22 @ 1:30p
